precondition: The Windows XP desktop is visible.
The right-click context menu is open on the Windows XP desktop, showing the "Properties" option.
expected_results: The context menu will close, and the "Display Properties" window will open. The "Themes" tab will be active by default.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Themes" tab is active.
expected_results: The "Display Properties" window will display the "Screen Saver" tab. The "Screen saver" dropdown menu will display "Windows XP", and the "Wait" field will be set to "10".

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Screen Saver" tab is active. The "Wait" spin box should display "10" and "minutes" should be selected.
action: Click the down arrow of the "Wait" spin box.
expected_results: A dropdown menu will appear, allowing you to select a different time unit.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Screen Saver" tab is selected. The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu is open.
action: Click on "3D FlowerBox" in the "Screen Saver" dropdown menu.
expected_results: The "Screen Saver" dropdown menu will close. The "Wait" time will change to "1" minute. A yellow pop-up notification reading "Keep your computer up to date" will appear in the bottom right corner of the screen.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "Screen Saver" tab is active. The "Power..." button is visible at the bottom of the window.
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will open.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power Schemes" tab is active. The "Power schemes" dropdown menu is visible.
action: Click the "Power schemes" dropdown menu and select "Home/Office Desk".
expected_results: The "Turn off monitor" setting under "Settings for Home/Office Desk power scheme" will change to "After 20 mins". Additionally, a pop-up window titled "Keep your computer up to date" may appear in the bottom right corner of the screen.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power Schemes" tab is active. The "Power schemes" dropdown menu at the top is visible.
action: Click the "Power schemes" dropdown menu and select "Presentation".
expected_results: The power scheme will change to "Presentation" and the "Turn off monitor" setting will change from "Never" to "After 20 mins".

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu is visible.
action: Click the down arrow of the "Turn off monitor" dropdown menu.
expected_results: A list of time options will appear, allowing you to select how long the computer should remain inactive before turning off the monitor.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open and the "Power Schemes" tab is active. The "System hibernates:" drop-down menu within the "Settings for Always On power scheme" section is visible.
action: Click the "Never" option in the "System hibernates:" drop-down menu.
expected_results: The system will be set to never hibernate automatically. A yellow pop-up notification reading "Keep your computer up to date" may appear in the bottom right corner of the screen.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open with the "Power Schemes" tab selected. The "Apply" button at the bottom of the window is active.
expected_results: The changes made to the "Always On" power scheme settings will be applied.

precondition: The "Power Options Properties" window is open with the "Power Schemes" tab selected. The "Always On" power scheme is selected, and the "Settings for Always On power scheme" are set as desired.
expected_results: The "Power Options Properties" window will close.

precondition: The "Display Properties" window is open and the "OK" button is highlighted.
expected_results: The "Display Properties" window will close and the Windows XP desktop background will be visible.
